abstract: The debate over whether some struggling banks should be nationalized is based on misinformation, says Kenneth D. Lewis, chief executive of Bank of America, the bank that has been cited as candidate for just such a move.
lead_paragraph: The debate over whether some struggling banks should be nationalized is based on misinformation, says Kenneth D. Lewis, chief executive of Bank of America, the bank that has been cited as candidate for just such a move.

headline.main: Lewis Tries to Debunk ‘Myths’ About Nationalization

abstract: Bank of America has become the first U.S. bank to withdraw job offers made to foreign M.B.A. students graduating from U.S. business schools this summer, according to The Financial Times.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America has become the first U.S. bank to withdraw job offers made to foreign M.B.A. students graduating from U.S. business schools this summer, according to The Financial Times.

headline.main: BofA Withdraws Job Offers to Foreign M.B.A. Students

abstract: Following through on what he said he would do, Attorney General Andrew Cuomo of New York on Monday sent a letter to Bank of America seeking information on bonuses paid out to its employees and those of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Following through on what he said he would do, Attorney General Andrew Cuomo of New York on Monday sent a letter to Bank of America seeking information on bonuses paid out to its employees and those of Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Cuomo, Frank Demand BofA Bonus Data
